skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills that extend agent capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations. Use this skill when the user asks to: (1) create a new skill, (2) make a skill, (3) build a skill, (4) set up a skill, (5) initialize a skill, (6) scaffold a skill, (7) update or modify an existing skill, (8) validate a skill, (9) learn about skill structure, (10) understand how skills work, or (11) get guidance on skill design patterns. Trigger on phrases like "create a skill", "new skill", "make a skill", "skill for X", "how do I create a skill", or "help me build a skill".
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills that extend agent capabilities with specialized knowledge, workf...
skill.author: langchain-ai

security_audit.summary: This skill is a legitimate skill creation toolkit with filesystem and script capabilities aligned to its stated purpose. The static analyzer flagged documentation examples containing path references and markdown code formatting as security issues. After evaluation: all 163 findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The code performs standard file operations (directory creation, file validation, permission setting) using Python pathlib with no network access, no credential handling, no subprocess execution, and no obfuscation. The critical heuristic warning about 'Code execution + Network + Credential access' is invalid - no such combination exists in this codebase.

content.user_title: Create effective AI skills with templates
content.value_statement: Creating AI skills from scratch requires understanding structure, best practices, and validation. This skill provides step-by-step guidance and automated tools to build, scaffold, and validate skills for any domain or workflow.
actual_capabilities: Initialize new skill directories with proper structure and templates
Validate skill YAML frontmatter and naming conventions
Guide skill design with proven patterns and best practices
Create bundled resources including scripts, references, and assets
Implement progressive disclosure for context-efficient skills
Test and iterate on skills based on real usage
limitations: Does not execute arbitrary code or perform runtime skill operations
Does not access external APIs or network resources
Does not modify existing skills without explicit user direction
Does not provide domain-specific content beyond guidance

use_cases.title: Build domain-specific skills
use_cases.description: Create specialized skills for finance, healthcare, legal, or any domain requiring expert knowledge and workflows.

use_cases.title: Standardize agent capabilities
use_cases.description: Package team knowledge and procedures into reusable skills that extend agent capabilities across your organization.

use_cases.title: Add tool integrations
use_cases.description: Create skills that provide file format support, API integrations, or specialized processing capabilities.

prompt_templates.title: Create basic skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill called data-processor that helps with CSV and JSON data processing tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Scaffold complex skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Scaffold a skill for document processing with support for PDF extraction, DOCX editing, and form filling.

prompt_templates.title: Add resources
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a Python script to the current skill that rotates PDF pages and saves the output.

prompt_templates.title: Validate skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate the skill at ~/.deepagents/agent/skills/my-new-skill and fix any errors.

output_examples.input: Create a skill for API documentation
output: Created scripts/ directory with example utilities
Created references/ for API specs and examples
Next: Edit SKILL.md with your API documentation patterns

output_examples.input: Build a skill for customer support
output: Created bundled resources: scripts/, references/, assets/
Added example script for ticket processing
Added reference documentation for response templates
Ready to customize with your support workflows

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines and use progressive disclosure to load detailed references only when needed.
Include scripts only for deterministic operations that are repeatedly rewritten across tasks.
Use hyphen-case naming with max 64 characters and provide comprehensive trigger descriptions.
anti_patterns: Adding README, INSTALLATION_GUIDE, or CHANGELOG files inside the skill directory.
Loading all reference documentation into context instead of loading files on demand.
Including credentials, secrets, or hardcoded API keys in skill files.

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each tool can trigger the skill based on description patterns.

faq.question: What is the maximum skill name length?
faq.answer: Skill names must use hyphen-case and cannot exceed 64 characters. Use only lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens.

faq.question: Can I include Python scripts in my skill?
faq.answer: Yes. Place scripts in the scripts/ directory. Scripts can be executed without loading into context, saving tokens.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using skill creation tools?
faq.answer: Yes. The scripts only read and write to user-specified directories. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why does my skill validation fail?
faq.answer: Common issues include missing YAML frontmatter, invalid name format, angle brackets in description, or missing required name and description fields.

faq.question: How is this different from prompt engineering?
faq.answer: Skills package persistent knowledge, scripts, and resources. Unlike prompts, skills persist across sessions and can include executable code.
